So, looks like if you add a 1 man command pod on top of your rocket, and a sturdy ladder down to the external command seat... then, have your kerbal do an eva... go down to the seat, right click on it... and board it! Congrats!! You are now sitting externally on the rocket.

Optional: Make the command module your lowest stage, attach seperatrons to it, and eject it.

Caution: After careful experimentation with this, the external Kerbal will destabilize your rocket (due to asymmetrical drag), and it will be rather challenging to get it into orbit.

Note: A few, brave kerbals were killed to verify that yes, this actually does work...

Also Note: Using all stock parts, no mods... Plain vanilla (v0.20)!

To get a Kerbal available, I just built a ship consisting of a Mk-I Lander Can and nothing else (I call it the "Port-a-John 7"). You just have him EVA, walk down out of the Launch Pad area (or be nice and give him a lift on a rover you've also driven off the launch pad), then put your SRB/seat combo ship on the pad, and have him climb in. You get to kill a Kerbal and maybe toast a rover this way...
